title: Enacts provisions to reduce the incidence of motor vehicle insurance fraud
summary: Grants the superintendent of insurance authority to investigate fraudulent activities, such as motor vehicle operators who drive with no insurance coverage, and those who misrepresent their principal place of residence or where their motor vehicle is principally garaged and operated; authorizes the insurance frauds bureau to accept reports of suspected fraudulent insurance actions; requires insurance companies and self-insurers to report incidents of insurance fraud to the insurance department; provides for compensation to law enforcement agencies for the prosecution of insurance fraud; directs the superintendent of state police to establish an insurance fraud reward program to those who report insurance fraud; directs the division of criminal justice services to collect and analyze information on insurance fraud; includes within the class D felony of forgery in the second degree, the forgery of a certificate of insurance or an insurance identification card; includes within the class C felony of forgery in the first degree, the forgery of 10 or more written instruments; includes within the class E felony of insurance fraud in the fourth degree, the operation of a motor vehicle in this state when the vehicle is insured in another state, but it is actually garaged in this state or the owner principally resides in this state; provides for the civil forfeiture of the proceeds of a fraudulent insurance act; requires applicants for motor vehicle registrations and driver's licenses to provide the department of motor vehicles with the address of their principal place of residence; establishes a temporary task force on motor vehicle insurance fraud.

    6    S 22. Temporary task force on motor vehicle insurance fraud.  (a)  The
    7  superintendent of insurance and the commissioner of motor vehicles shall
    8  convene a temporary task force on motor vehicle insurance fraud to exam-
    9  ine  the  feasibility and cost-effectiveness of developing methodologies
   10  to identify owners and operators of motor vehicles who misrepresent  the
   11  principal  place  of  their  residence or where their motor vehicles are
   12  garaged and operated. Such task force shall develop a plan on the feasi-
   13  bility of implementing a statewide registry of the street  addresses  of
   14  the  owners  and  operators  of motor vehicles in this state. The report
   15  issued by this task force shall:
   16    (1) investigate the  feasibility  of  developing  and  implementing  a
   17  statewide  registry  of the addresses of motor vehicle owners and opera-
   18  tors;
   19    (2) detail the costs of establishing such a registry;
   20    (3) identify the parameters for entering and retrieving data from such
   21  registry; and
   22    (4) evaluate the value of establishing such  registry  in  identifying
   23  motor vehicle owners and operators who misrepresent their place of resi-
   24  dence or where their vehicle is garaged and operated.
   25    (b)  The task force shall consist of 13 members. The superintendent of
   26  insurance and the commissioner of motor vehicles,  or  their  designees,
   27  shall  be  members  of  the task force and shall be the co-chairs of the
   28  task force. A representative of the New York Automobile  Insurance  Plan
   29  shall  be  a  member of the task force. The remaining ten members of the
   30  task force shall be appointed as follows: four shall be appointed by the
   31  governor, two shall be appointed  by  the  temporary  president  of  the
   32  senate, two shall be appointed by the speaker of the assembly, one shall
   33  be  appointed  by  the  minority  leader of the senate, and one shall be
   34  appointed by the minority leader of the assembly. Of such  ten  members:
   35  three  shall be representatives of insurers actively writing motor vehi-
   36  cle insurance in this state,  three  shall  be  representatives  of  the
   37  insurance  agent  and  broker  community  actively selling motor vehicle
   38  insurance in this state, two shall be representatives of  companies  the
   39  business of which involves collecting, dispersing and synthesizing data,
   40  and  two  shall be representatives of the motor vehicle insurance buying
   41  public.
   42    (c) The task force shall submit a  report  to  the  governor  and  the
   43  legislature  of  its  findings,  conclusions  and recommendations within
   44  fifteen months of the effective date of this section.
